intro: Persicaria hastatotriloba f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered smartweed, is a variant of the smartweed species native to North America. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and stems that are often reddish in color. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
